translator_notes: 「红楼梦」(Hónglóumèng) literally means 'Dream of the Red Chamber' - 红楼 refers to the vermilion chambers where noble women resided
「脂砚斋」(Zhiyan Zhai) was a primary commentator of the manuscript, possibly a close relative or confidant of Cao Xueqin; identity still debated among scholars
「汇校本」indicates this is a collated edition combining variants from multiple manuscript sources (甲戌本, 庚辰本, 己卯本, etc.)

The illustration depicts a classical beauty (仕女) in a garden setting with plum blossoms (梅花) and bamboo (竹), symbolizing refinement and nobility - likely representing Lin Daiyu or a generic representation of the novel's female characters
Plum, orchid, bamboo, and chrysanthemum (梅兰竹菊) are known as the 'Four Gentlemen' in Chinese art, representing noble qualities
research_notes: This edition is version 3.13, released July 20, 2009, by the 抚琴居红楼梦文学社区 (Fuqinju Honglou Meng Literary Community)
The Zhiping commentaries are crucial for understanding authorial intent, as they were written by contemporaries of Cao Xueqin
This cover design emphasizes the scholarly nature of the edition by highlighting the commentary tradition
